description: This course is an introduction to linguistic perspectives on the languages native to the Americas (their nature and distribution, typological similarities and differences), with an emphasis on North America. The diverse languages of this region will be examined from the point of view of particular linguistic phenomena, such as phonology, morphology, and syntax; and in addition we will study their historical development and their place in culture, society, and thought.
name: LANG IN NATIVE AMERICA: Language in Native America

section.name: LANG IN NATIVE AMERICA: Language in Native America
